contentMetadata.content:
{{Short description|American media production company}} {{Infobox company | name = Hoorae Media | logo = Hoorae_Media_logo.png | logo_caption = | logo_alt = | type = Private | industry = Entertainment | predecessor = Issa Rae Productions | founded = {{Start date and age|2020|9}} in [[Inglewood, California]], U.S. | founder = [[Issa Rae]] | successor = | hq_location_city = Inglewood, California | hq_location_country = U.S. | area_served = | key_people = {{plainlist| *Sara Rastogi *Montrel McKay }} | products = [[Film|Motion pictures]]
[[Television show|Television programs]]
Audio content | services = {{Plainlist| *[[Filmmaking#Production|Film production]] *[[Television production]] *[[Audio production]] }} | owner = Issa Rae ([[CEO]]) | num_employees = 23 | num_employees_year = 2021 | parent = | website = {{URL|https://www.issarae.com}} | former_name = Issa Rae Productions {{small|(2011–20)}} }} '''Hoorae Media''' (pronounced "hooray"), also known as '''Hoorae''', is an American media production company formed in September 2020 by [[Issa Rae]]. Formerly known as '''Issa Rae Productions''', Hoorae launched as an umbrella banner to consolidate her various film, television, and digital content companies. [[Insecure (TV series)|''Insecure'']] and ''[[A Black Lady Sketch Show]]'' are produced by Hoorae with [[HBO]]. Upcoming projects include the [[HBO Max]] series ''[[Rap Sh!t]]'', a revival of ''[[Project Greenlight]]'', and the film ''Sinkhole'', produced with [[Monkeypaw Productions]] and [[Universal Pictures]].{{Cite web|last=McNary|first=Dave|date=2020-09-30|title=Issa Rae Launches Hoorae Production Company for Film, TV, Digital (EXCLUSIVE)|url=https://variety.com/2020/film/news/issa-rae-hoorae-production-film-tv-digital-1234787811/|access-date=2021-06-03|website=Variety|language=en-US}} == History == In September 2020 [[Issa Rae]] launched Hoorae, a media company and umbrella banner to consolidate film and TV projects from Issa Rae Productions and her other media projects. Hoorae comprises a film and television division, Raedio audio content (launched in 2019), ColorCreative management, and digital brands.{{Cite magazine|last=Spanos|first=Brittany|date=2021-04-15|title=Issa Rae Can't Stop, Won't Stop|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/tv/tv-features/issa-rae-insecure-hbo-1155867/|access-date=2021-06-03|magazine=Rolling Stone|language=en-US}} In March 2021 Rae signed a five-year $40 million deal that gives exclusive television rights to [[HBO]], [[HBO Max]], and [[Warner Bros.]], and a first-look deal to [[WarnerMedia]] brands for any film projects.{{Cite web|last=Jackson|first=Angelique|date=2021-03-24|title=Issa Rae's Next Chapter: How 'Insecure' Creator Is Becoming a Media Mogul With Production Banner Hoorae|url=https://variety.com/2021/tv/news/issa-rae-insecure-hbo-hoorae-1234936020/|access-date=2021-06-03|website=Variety|language=en-US}} The company promoted Sara Rastogi to senior vice president. Rae is the chief executive officer and Montrel McKay is the president of Hoorae film and TV. In 2019 the company, then known as Issa Rae Productions, opened an office in [[Inglewood, California|Inglewood]], California.{{Cite magazine|last=Mims|first=Taylor|date=2020-02-13|title=From TV to Music Mogul: How Issa Rae Is Giving Artists A Leg Up|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/8550816/issa-rae-productions-raedio-company-insecure-interview|access-date=2021-06-03|magazine=Billboard|language=en}} Hoorae has 23 employees as of March 2021. == Filmography == === Television === {| class="wikitable" |+ ! Year(s) ! Title ! Co-producers ! Distributor |- | rowspan="4" |TBA | ''Perfect Strangers'' | [[Spyglass Media Group]], Eagle Pictures and 3 Marys Entertainment | TBA |- | ''Ghost in the Machine'' | [[Heyday Films]] | [[Netflix]] |- | ''Sinkhole'' | [[Monkeypaw Productions]] | rowspan="2" | [[Universal Pictures]] |- | ''Juju''{{Cite web|last=Patten|first=Dominic|date=2020-12-08|title=Issa Rae & La La Anthony To Produce Horror Comedy 'Juju' At Universal; Angelica Nwandu To Pen, Thembi Banks To Direct|url=https://deadline.com/2020/12/issa-rae-la-la-anthony-juju-horror-comedy-universal-thembi-banks-angelica-nwandu-1234652192/|access-date=2021-06-03|website=Deadline|language=en-US}} | [[La La Anthony]] |} == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [https://www.imdb.com/search/title/?companies=co0363033 Hoorae] on IMDb *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9YKhhAvmDaY "Introducing Hoorae"] on YouTube *[https://www.issarae.com Issa Rae's official website] {{Authority control}} {{Issa Rae}} {{Film studios}} [[Category:Film production companies of the United States]] [[Category:Entertainment companies established in 2020]] [[Category:American companies established in 2020]] [[Category:Entertainment companies based in California]] [[Category:American independent film studios]] [[Category:Mass media companies established in 2020]] [[Category:African-American mass media]] [[Category:2020 establishments in California]] [[Category:Hoorae Media| ]] [[Category:Companies based in Los Angeles County, California]]
contentMetadata.text: Hoorae Media (pronounced "hooray"), also known as Hoorae, is an American media production company formed in September 2020 by Issa Rae. Formerly known as Issa Rae Productions, Hoorae launched as an umbrella banner to consolidate her various film, television, and digital content companies. Insecure and A Black Lady Sketch Show are produced by Hoorae with HBO. Upcoming projects include the HBO Max series Rap Sh!t, a revival of Project Greenlight, and the film Sinkhole, produced with Monkeypaw Productions and Universal Pictures. In September 2020 Issa Rae launched Hoorae, a media company and umbrella banner to consolidate film and TV projects from Issa Rae Productions and her other media projects. Hoorae comprises a film and television division, Raedio audio content (launched in 2019), ColorCreative management, and digital brands. In March 2021 Rae signed a five-year $40 million deal that gives exclusive television rights to HBO, HBO Max, and Warner Bros., and a first-look deal to WarnerMedia brands for any film projects. The company promoted Sara Rastogi to senior vice president. Rae is the chief executive officer and Montrel McKay is the president of Hoorae film and TV. In 2019 the company, then known as Issa Rae Productions, opened an office in Inglewood, California. Hoorae has 23 employees as of March 2021. Jackson, Angelique (2021-03-24). "Issa Rae's Next Chapter: How 'Insecure' Creator Is Becoming a Media Mogul With Production Banner Hoorae". Variety. Retrieved 2021-06-03. McNary, Dave (2020-09-30). "Issa Rae Launches Hoorae Production Company for Film, TV, Digital (EXCLUSIVE)". Variety. Retrieved 2021-06-03. Spanos, Brittany (2021-04-15). "Issa Rae Can't Stop, Won't Stop". Rolling Stone. Retrieved 2021-06-03. Mims, Taylor (2020-02-13). "From TV to Music Mogul: How Issa Rae Is Giving Artists A Leg Up". Billboard. Retrieved 2021-06-03. Petski, Denise (2021-05-18). "HBO Max Orders 'Sweet Life: Los Angeles' Reality Series From Issa Rae". Deadline. Retrieved 2021-06-03. Petski, Denise (2021-05-18). "'Project Greenlight' Revival From Issa Rae Gets Series Order At HBO Max". Deadline. Retrieved 2021-06-03. Petski, Denise (2021-03-24). "Issa Rae Inks Big Overall TV & Film Deal With WarnerMedia". Deadline. Retrieved 2021-06-03. Goldberg, Lesley (2021-06-10). "Jaboukie Young-White Adapting 'Gang's All Queer' for HBO, Issa Rae". The Hollywood Reporter. Retrieved 2021-06-11. Patten, Dominic (2020-12-08). "Issa Rae & La La Anthony To Produce Horror Comedy 'Juju' At Universal; Angelica Nwandu To Pen, Thembi Banks To Direct". Deadline. Retrieved 2021-06-03. Hoorae on IMDb "Introducing Hoorae" on YouTube Issa Rae's official website

Audio content | services = {{Plainlist| *[[Filmmaking#Production|Film production]] *[[Television production]] *[[Audio production]] }} | owner = Issa Rae ([[CEO]]) | num_employees = 23 | num_employees_year = 2021 | parent = | website = {{URL|https://www.issarae.com}} | former_name = Issa Rae Productions {{small|(2011–20)}} }} Hoorae Media (pronounced "hooray"), also known as Hoorae, is an American media production company formed in September 2020 by [[Issa Rae]]. texts.title: History
texts.value:
In September 2020 [[Issa Rae]] launched Hoorae, a media company and umbrella banner to consolidate film and TV projects from Issa Rae Productions and her other media projects.<ref name="variety-mcnary" /> Hoorae comprises a film and television division, Raedio audio content (launched in 2019), ColorCreative management, and digital brands.<ref>{{Cite magazine|last=Spanos|first=Brittany|date=2021-04-15|title=Issa Rae Can't Stop, Won't Stop|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/tv/tv-features/issa-rae-insecure-hbo-1155867/|access-date=2021-06-03|magazine=Rolling Stone|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name="variety-mcnary" /> In March 2021 Rae signed a five-year $40 million deal that gives exclusive television rights to [[HBO]], [[HBO Max]], and [[Warner Bros.]], and a first-look deal to [[WarnerMedia]] brands for any film projects.<ref name=variety-jackson>{{Cite web|last=Jackson|first=Angelique|date=2021-03-24|title=Issa Rae's Next Chapter: How 'Insecure' Creator Is Becoming a Media Mogul With Production Banner Hoorae|url=https://variety.com/2021/tv/news/issa-rae-insecure-hbo-hoorae-1234936020/|access-date=2021-06-03|website=Variety|language=en-US}}</ref> 

The company promoted Sara Rastogi to senior vice president. Rae is the chief executive officer and Montrel McKay is the president of Hoorae film and TV.<ref name="variety-mcnary" /> In 2019 the company, then known as Issa Rae Productions, opened an office in [[Inglewood, California|Inglewood]], California.<ref>{{Cite magazine|last=Mims|first=Taylor|date=2020-02-13|title=From TV to Music Mogul: How Issa Rae Is Giving Artists A Leg Up|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/8550816/issa-rae-productions-raedio-company-insecure-interview|access-date=2021-06-03|magazine=Billboard|language=en}}</ref> Hoorae has 23 employees as of March 2021.<ref name="variety-jackson" />
